clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of Fruquintinib Combined With Capecitabine as First-line Treatment for Advanced Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Unsuitable for Intravenous Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Open-labeled, Single Arm Phase II Study of Fruquintinib Combined With Capecitabine as First-line Treatment for Advanced Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Unsuitable for Intravenous Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single center, open-labeled, single arm phase II study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of fruquintinib combined with capecitabine as first-line treatment for advanced metastatic colorectal cancer patients unsuitable for intravenous chemotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Fruquintinib is an oral small molecule inhibitor of VEGFR1/2/3, this phase II study aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of fruquintinib combined with capecitabine as first-line treatment for advanced metastatic colorectal cancer patients of elderly or those unsuitable for intravenous chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
primary_outcome.description: ORR according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version. 1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: OS is determined from the date of treatment to death from any cause or the last follow-up date

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is determined from the date of treatment to PD or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: DCR according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version. 1.1

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerance will be evaluated by incidence, severity and outcomes of adverse events (AEs) and categorized by severity in accordance with the NCI CTC AE Version 5.0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline to primary completion date, about 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life is assessed using the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ) C30. It will be evaluated at Screening, Tumor Assessment Visit and End of Treatment visit.

arm_group.description: Fruquintinib, 4mg/d, qd po, 2 weeks on, 1 week off; Capecitabine: 825mg/m2, bid po, 2 weeks on, 1 week off
